programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Maple Leafs skate with the Islanders. On Dec. 11, 2023, former New York star John Tavares had a goal and an assist for Toronto to reach 1,000 career points, but the Isles claimed a 4-3 overtime triumph. The Leafs are 11-3-5 on the road.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Broncos (11-6, 2-0 WCC) square off with the No. 23 Bulldogs (11-4, 2-0). Gonzaga has won 26 straight meetings with Santa Clara stretching back to 2011. Wyoming transfer Graham Ike (GONZ) is posting 15.2 points and eight rebounds per game.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Maple Leafs skate with the Islanders. On Dec. 11, 2023, former New York star John Tavares had a goal and an assist for Toronto to reach 1,000 career points, but the Isles claimed a 4-3 overtime triumph. The Leafs are 11-3-5 on the road.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Philadelphia welcome a challenge from traveling Sacramento. The 76ers have swept four straight season series and won nine in a row overall against the Kings. Philly is 13-6 on home court this season despite dropping its past two such contests.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pelicans and the Nuggets contest the rubber match of their season series. The teams split a pair of November 2023 meetings, with New Orleans taking the In-Season Tournament clash. Two-time MVP Nikola Jokic (DEN) triple-doubled in both matches.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pelicans and the Nuggets contest the rubber match of their season series. The teams split a pair of November 2023 meetings, with New Orleans taking the In-Season Tournament clash. Two-time MVP Nikola Jokic (DEN) triple-doubled in both matches.

programme.title: Postseason NFL Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the day's games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The red-hot No. 7 Tar Heels field a challenge from the Orange. North Carolina is off to a 4-0 start in conference play for the first time since 2015-16, when it won its first eight ACC contests. Syracuse prevailed in six of its last seven overall.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Wildcats (12-2, 2-0) roll into their SEC road test against the Aggies (9-6, 0-2). Kentucky has won six straight. Six-foot-6 senior guard Antonio Reeves paces the Wildcats with 18.6 points per game after totaling 90 in his last four.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Razorbacks try to make it four straight over the Gators in an SEC affair. Florida is 6-1 at home. Arkansas routed Florida 84-65 in Fayetteville last season. Razorbacks forward Jalen Graham provided 26 points and seven rebounds in that game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Cougars are mere mortals as they visit the Horned Frogs for a Big 12 game. The former Southwest Conference rivals meet for the first time since 2012. Houston was the nation's final unbeaten team before losing to Iowa State 57-53 on Jan. 9.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 14 Bears (13-2, 2-0) draw the Bearcats (12-3, 1-1) for a Big 12 engagement from Waco, Texas. The only previous meeting between the programs took place in 1946, a 55-45 Baylor victory in Ohio. The Bears are cruising with four straight wins.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From Centre Videotron in Quebec City.

programme.title: Postseason NFL Countdown
programme.desc: A review of the NFL playoffs and a look ahead to the Super Bowl.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 11 Hokies and No. 21 Seminoles square off for an ACC showdown in the Sunshine State. Virginia Tech has won eight in a row overall, and the last two meetings by a combined 31 points after the Seminoles took 30 of the first 40 engagements.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Red-hot No. 7 LSU rolls into Alabama for an SEC engagement with Auburn. LSU ran its remarkable winning streak to 16 games with an 87-70 victory over Texas A&M on Jan. 11. Aneesah Morrow (LSU) has averaged 19.8 points across her last four games.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Women's college basketball coverage.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 24 Owls continue their introduction to the American Athletic Conference by visiting the Green Wave. Tulane is 8-1 on home court. Florida Atlantic guard Johnell Davis is averaging 20.9 points per game since the start of December 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Utes reset at home with an opportunity against the Bruins. Utah had won eight straight before an unsuccessful trip to Arizona, taking two losses. Branden Carlson of South Jordan, Utah, averages 17.6 points and 1.5 blocks per game for the Utes.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Beavers (9-6, 1-3) and Cardinal (7-7, 2-2) link up for a Pac-12 engagement in Corvallis, Ore. Stanford has won three in a row against Oregon State. Sophomore guard Jordan Pope leads the Beavers with 17.9 points per game this season.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: From Feb. 1, 2015.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: From Feb. 5, 2017 in Houston.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The Patriots go for their sixth Super Bowl win as they take on Coach Sean McVay's Rams. From Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Feb. 3, 2019.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between coaching masters Bill Belichick and Bill Parcells that spans over four decades.

programme.title: ESPN FC
programme.desc: Highlights, news, reactions and opinions from the day in soccer.

programme.title: Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: FC Bayern München is up against TSG 1899 Hoffenheim at Allianz Arena in matchround 17 of the Bundesliga. Hoffenheim won one of its 15 Bundesliga away fixtures versus FC Bayern, a 2-1 victory on Oct. 5, 2019 (both away goals by Sargis Adamyan).

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Exclusive takes on the biggest news, stars, and stories from UFC.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Flyers (12-2, 2-0 A-10) look to push higher as they visit the Dukes (9-5, 0-2). Dayton seeks its 10th-straight victory after gliding by UMass 64-60 on Jan. 7. Arizona-born DaRon Holmes II leads the Flyers with 17.7 points and 2.2 blocks per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The fans at the Beeghly Center seek a repeat performance as the Raiders and Penguins take the floor. On Feb. 2, 2023, Youngstown State withstood a 44-point performance from Wright State's Trey Calvin, securing a 91-89 triumph in triple overtime.

programme.desc: Jimmy Houston visits unique locations and shares his fishing knowledge.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston Outdoors
programme.desc: Jimmy and John Robinson are bass fishing at Live Oak Plantation in Georgia.

programme.desc: Scott Martin and a challenger go head-to-head in a unique fishing tournament format.

programme.title: Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: Bass challenge in Ticonderoga, N.Y., for lake champion bragging rights.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Volunteers (11-4, 1-1 SEC) steel themselves for a match with the Bulldogs (12-3, 2-0). Tennessee was upset by another group of Bulldogs from Mississippi State, 77-72 on Jan. 10, while Georgia earned a 10th-straight win by topping Arkansas.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Demon Deacons (11-4, 3-1 ACC) aim to pick up the pieces when they host the Cavaliers (11-4, 2-2). Wake Forest's nine-game unbeaten run ended in an 87-82 loss Jan. 9 at Florida State. Virginia has won 10 of its last 11 contests against Wake.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Red Raiders (13-2, 2-0 Big 12) and Wildcats (12-3, 2-0) duel in the Lone Star State. Kansas State has racked up four straight victories, but Texas Tech is on a run of eight straight wins. The teams split the previous two season series.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cyclones (12-3, 1-1) and Cowboys (8-7, 0-2) engage in a Big 12 battle. Oklahoma State has claimed seven of the last eight contests against Iowa State, including the past three matchups. The Cyclones are 10-0 at the Hilton Coliseum this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bulldogs (13-3, 4-1 MVC) aim to keep their momentum as they visit the Salukis (12-4, 4-1). Drake's 89-78 victory over Indiana State on Jan. 10 created a five-way logjam atop the conference with Southern Illinois, Belmont and Murray State.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Trojans arrive in Boulder, Colo., to roam with the Buffaloes. USC has won three in a row over Colorado after sweeping last season's set of games. Senior Trojans guard Boogie Ellis totaled 35 points and eight assists in those 2022-23 victories.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: A look the 1972 Miami Dolphins, who 50 years ago won Super Bowl VII, completing the first and only undefeated season in NFL history.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: Talkin' Season - Nick Saban's Greatest Hits
ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 13 Tigers (14-2, 3-0 American) streak into a road contest against the Shockers (8-7, 0-2). Memphis has won nine straight following a hard-fought 107-101 overtime victory at home over Texas-San Antonio, and six in a row versus Wichita State.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Flames continue their quest to nail down their first Conference USA victory as they visit the Bulldogs in the inaugural meeting between the programs. Louisiana Tech is off to a pristine 8-0 start at the Thomas Assembly Center this season.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: Boys High School Basketball
programme.desc: From Blake Arena in Springfield, Mass.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Jahmir Young and the Terrapins (9-6, 1-3 Big Ten) host the Wolverines (6-9, 1-3). Young raised his average to 19.9 points per game after totaling 106 in his last four. Maryland snapped a five-game series slide with a 64-58 victory last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 10 Fighting Illini (11-3, 2-1 Big Ten) seek their fourth-straight win over the Spartans (9-6, 1-3). Illinois comes off an 83-78 loss at No. 1 Purdue. Tyson Walker (MSU) averages 20.6 points per game after totaling 71 in his last three.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Sun Devils visit the Huskies for a Pac-12 game. Arizona State has won four straight following a 76-73 decision over Colorado. Washington's Keion Brooks Jr. averages 20.5 points per game after scoring 26 in a 79-72 triumph over Oregon State.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hoosiers host the Golden Gophers. Minnesota snapped a 10-game slide versus Maryland in its last contest, in addition to stretching its own win streak to seven contests. Indiana beat Minnesota 61-57 in 2022-23 for a sixth straight series triumph.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Blue Demons and Wildcats wrap up their Big East regular-season series with this game in Philadelphia. Villanova palindromically dismantled DePaul 84-48 on Dec. 23, 2023, to avenge last season's loss in Chicago. Hakim Hart led Nova with 20 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Wolf Pack try to keep pace with their rivals when they host the Broncos in Mountain West Conference action. Boise State has won four of the last five meetings with Nevada. Kenan Blackshear (NEV) averaged 16 points in last season's series split.

programme.title: Bassmaster: the Cast
programme.desc: B.A.S.S. Membership, Television and National Tournaments take the sport of bass fishing to a new level in the 80s.

programme.title: Bassmaster: the Cast
programme.desc: In the 90s, B.A.S.S. celebrates 25 years, creates the first Bass Angler millionare and makes dreams come true through grass roots tournament fishing.

programme.title: Bassmaster: the Cast
programme.desc: As an early Star on the B.A.S.S tournament circuit, Bill Dance becomes one of the biggest celebrities in the fishing industry.

programme.title: Bassmaster Review
programme.desc: The Sabine River always features close weights and huge crowds, the 2023 version showed much of the same in the delta region of southeast Texas.

programme.title: Bassmaster Review
programme.desc: When the temperatures hit triple digits in the south, the Bassmaster Elite Series heads north and the first stop of the northern swing takes place at Lake St. Clair.

programme.title: Magnify Presents: Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: Tyquone's a teenage basketball star, but beyond a championship he wants to see the world. This finds him grappling with dreams bigger than the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates meet the Bulldogs in Big East play. On Jan. 9, Seton Hall won for the sixth time in seven tries as Al-Amir Dawes' 25 points keyed a win over Georgetown. Seton Hall leads the all-time series with Butler following a season sweep in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The reeling Friars (11-5, 2-3 Big East) try to get right against the Musketeers (7-8, 1-3). Providence has lost three straight after St. John's secured a 75-73 win on Jan. 10. Last season, Xavier swept both meetings for the first time since 2015-16.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Musketeers (1-12, 0-4 Big East) try to pull out of a tailspin against the Pirates (10-6, 2-3). Seton Hall is 9-0 against Xavier since the start of 2019-20, including an 84-58 thrashing in the first round of the 2023 Big East Tournament.

programme.desc: Ryan Kalkbrenner and the No. 22 Bluejays host the Red Storm for a Big East game. Creighton has claimed six straight meetings. Kalkbrenner, a 7-foot-1 senior, averages 15.8 points and 7.3 rebounds per contest after totaling 42 and 21 in his last two.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: An elite tilt atop the Big Ten pits the No. 3 Hawkeyes (16-1, 5-0) against the No. 14 Hoosiers (14-1, 5-0). The sides split the season series in 2022-23, with Iowa superstar Caitlin Clark averaging 34.5 points and 9.5 assists in those contests.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers (21-15) and the Nets (16-21) clash in the third NBA Paris Game. Cleveland has won three straight meetings after escaping Brooklyn with a 114-113 decision in the season opener Oct. 25, 2023. Cam Thomas (BKN) netted 36 points in the loss.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
